metadata.name: Forfiles.EXE Child Process Masquerading
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of "forfiles" from a non-default location, in order to potentially spawn a custom "cmd.exe" from the current working directory.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('.exe"'))) AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) AND startswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/c echo "')) AND NOT ((contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower(':\\windows\\system32\\')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower(':\\windows\\syswow64\\'))) AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\forfiles.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.name), lower(':\\windows\\system32\\')) OR contains(lower(process.name), lower(':\\windows\\syswow64\\'))) AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of "forfiles" from a non-default location, in order to potentially spawn a custom "cmd.exe" from the current working directory.
